thread.title: Quantum Corporation (QTM) Investigated By Block & Leviton For Violations Of The Federal Securities Laws After Disclosing SEC Subpoena And Delayed Earnings; Shareholders Encouraged To Contact The Firm

author: cnbc.com
title: Quantum Corporation (QTM) Investigated By Block & Leviton For Violations Of The Federal Securities Laws After Disclosing SEC Subpoena And Delayed Earnings; Shareholders Encouraged To Contact The Firm
text:
BOSTON, Feb. 8, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- Block & Leviton LLP ( www.blockesq.com ), a securities litigation firm representing investors nationwide, is investigating whether Quantum Corporation ("Quantum" or the "Company") (NYSE: QTM) and certain of its officers and directors violated federal securities laws.
On February 8, 2018, Quantum disclosed that in January of 2018, the Company received a subpoena from the Commission (SEC) related to revenue recognition for certain transactions, prompting an internal investigation by Quantum, which remains ongoing. As a result, the Company announced that it "is postponing release of its fiscal third quarter 2018 results and its earnings conference call."
On this news, shares have fallen more than 10% in premarket trading, causing millions in losses to investors.
If you purchased or otherwise acquired Quantum securities and have questions about your legal rights or possess information relevant to this investigation, you are encouraged to contact attorney Bradley Vettraino at (617) 398-5600, by email at bradley@blockesq.com , or by visiting www.blockesq.com/quantum .
Confidentiality to whistleblowers or others with information relevant to this investigation is assured.
Block & Leviton LLP is a Boston-based law firm representing investors nationwide. The firm's lawyers have collectively been prosecuting securities cases on behalf of individual and institutional investors for over 50 years, and have recovered billions of dollars on their behalf. Block & Leviton's investigations into corporate wrongdoing were recently covered by the New York Times.
